page.title: 12ARABLE FARMING IN WADESMILL
page.content: This farm in the Rib Valley occupies about 170acres most of which is used to grow cereal crops of wheat and barley with one or two fields of oil-seed rape. The wheat,either sown in winter or spring is stored in six large cyclindrical grain stores before being sold to a local milling company for processing into flour. The barley is either used as animal fodder or in the local malting. Oil-seed rape,a relatively new crop, belongs to the cabbage family, producing bright yellow flowers in May and June. The seeds from these are crushed to extract vegetable oil which fetches a good price. The farmer uses it as a break crop between years of cereal growing, though it exhausts the soil so it is not grown on the same field more than one year in five. Near the farm are two meadows for horses.
